item.title: Report X-2023090716
item.description:
Report X-2023090716

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE AUDITOR NOTED A STRONG ODOR EMANATING FROM PACKAGE, AND NOTIFIED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA. INSPECTING THE PACKAGE REVEALED THAT ONE OF FOUR INNER CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP, CAUSING LIQUID TO LEAK ONTO THE CARDBOARD, STAINING IT. CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALVAGE DRUM. ALL CONTENTS WERE DISPOSED OF THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023090367
item.description:
Report X-2023090367

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023090367 SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat was discovered in the trailer as it was being unloaded at MPGR yesterday afternoon. unload manager called it out to QA over the radio. QA responded and retrieved it, placing the damaged package in a lined tote and bringing it over to the damage area, moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: all four bottles leaked varying amounts due to the necks being dented inward, distorting the bottle forms and allowing product to leak from or near caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. 2. X-2023090371 SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat was discovered in the trailer as it was being unloaded. unload manager notified QA via radio. QA admins responded and retrieved the package, placing it in a lined tote and bringing it back to the damage area, moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to dented neck. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats.

item.title: Report X-2023090349
item.description:
Report X-2023090349

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat was found in the unload last night, already having been placed in a lined tote. HAP specialist processed the hazmat (this is the origin) and brought it back to the damage area, placing it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: three bottles leaked due to loose caps. all have stained labels. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023090346
item.description:
Report X-2023090346

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was discovered this morning on the inbound. upon finding that the material was paint-like, inbound QA set it aside on the drain mats for HESS specialist coming in later that day. HESS specialist inspected and confirmed that the product was regulated. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one can leaked due to loose lid clips and denting. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote on drain mats
